Books    Maps & GIS    Digital Images    Using Special Collections & University Archives    Special Collections Research Guides       Eyebrow menu    Contact Us    My Accounts    Give to the Library    COVID-19    UIC menu    UIC.edu    Campus Map    UIC Today     Toggle Search                Breadcrumbs    Home    Help     Request items   Staff, students, faculty and emeritus faculty can request items from other libraries. I-Share will quickly deliver physical items from Illinois academic libraries. Interlibrary Loan (ILLiad) will allow you to request scanned articles and items not available in I-Share.       Log in to I-Share  Log in to ILLiad  If you have trouble logging in, you can set up a Library account .   How to request books and media in I-Share   Search I-Share for an item  Click on what you need!  Click “Request from I-Share Libraries” button  Log in, or create account   Register once by linking your UIC “Library ID Number” with your record.  You only need your NetID and password to order items.  Do you need your item sent to a library closer to you?  Change the “preferred pick-up location” to any institution participating in I-Share. You’ll get an email when the item is ready to pick up, usually in 3-5 business days.  How to request scanned articles and items from libraries worldwide in ILLiad   Login to ILLiad  Once you are logged into ILLiad click Find it @ UIC in library databases or in Google Scholar to pre-fill the request form for articles.  John Marshall Law School patrons can make ILL requests through a separate ILL system .  More help with ILLiad   Following the “Find it @ UIC” link is the simplest way to place a request. In Google Scholar, the link is sometimes hidden under the >> symbol.  You’ll get an email when the item is ready to pick up or posted electronically (usually 1-10 business days).  Most requests for physical items (books, DVDs, microfilm, etc.) are filled within 5-10 business days.  Most article requests are filled within 1-4 business days.  Articles are delivered as scanned PDFs.   Need help? Contact us or learn more about library accounts .      How Do I...?
